title: How to become a freelance writer and where do I do it - Quora

response.answer_text: A2A. Basic would be to create a portfolio. There are free blogs websites you could register on, like WordPress. Build up your profile with as many pieces of blog posts as possible. Write on topics you know. Could be your neighborhood, city, a mall/other places one could visit. You could also write about hobby topics, in a manner of connecting - things happening in the specific field globally to what is available locally. There's no dearth of topics. Once you have a portfolio, you can leave links on future blogs, social media posts,etc. There are several websites which could connect you with prospective employers. Like Freelancer, Upwork etc. Wherever I am writing etc. it means there are several options (not possible for me to list them all). Give it a shot. Good Luck ! :)

The biggest advantages that freelancers have over contracted workers are that they can freely work on any and as many projects of their choice without being bounded by any contract, that too from multiple sources. Not just that, freelancers can choose the time and cost of the work as per their convenience as well. The following freelancing businesses are most popularly in demand as of 2018. Freelance PhotographyFreelance Content WriterFreelance Web DesignerFreelance App DeveloperFreelance Graphic DesignerNow no matter what type of freelancing you wish to do, the best way to start your journey is by signing up with freelancing platforms. These are online platforms that have been designed to bridge the gap between businesses and freelancers. Some platforms either freelancers to upload their profiles and portfolios for clients to contact them or for work, while some allow clients to organize contests to hire the best freelancers. Signing up to these freelancing platforms is free. Here are some of the most popular freelancing platforms you can signup with. FreelancerFreelanceMyWayFiverrUpworkElanceIf you are looking for work, you can sign up and create a free profile showcasing your creative skills. Employers looking to hire a freelancer will find you based on your skill set. The previous work you include in your profile will ensure your future employer you are qualified for the job. You can also search for jobs according to your field of expertise and place your bids corresponding to project bids posted by businesses looking to hire people.

This is easy to answer but a bit harder to do. First, do you have a professional writing background? I don’t mean academic writing. I mean doing journalism or copy writing or technical writing or any form of paid writing to specs and a deadline. If not, your first step would be finding projects - even volunteer work - to build a portfolio.You need to demonstrate your skill so you need ‘clips’ or samples of your work. Second, may I refer you to the Freelance Writers Den? I don’t own it and it isn’t my business and I get nothing from the referral. However I am a member and I think it offers some of the best, most realistic, and useful advice and resources for people who want to become freelance writers. Google it and it will pop up. It may not be open - but you can get on the waiting list for the next opening. In the meantime, you can check out the free website of the site owner, which also offers useful information. Make A Living Writing - Practical Help for Hungry Writers Good luck.

Hi, The answer is a bit subjective. Are you looking to first learn the “ins and outs” of freelance writing? All the things to avoid, warning signs, how to approach clients, and so on? If so, look into writing-based communities and be sure to ask specific questions in order to get a clear picture. For example, start with a basic Google search such as “Writing forum” or “Forum for writers” or even “Freelance writing basics.” Those very same places can also give you more specific venues where you can find writing gigs, considering all the different types of clients available out there.

I almost didn’t answer this question because if you have to ask such a basic question it means you were too lazy to do the most elementary bit of research about writing as a career. And if you are that foggy about this, it suggests you do not read much. If you are not a reader, you will not make a good writer. I would suggest that if, despite the answers you are seeing, you still want to learn more, go to web sites such as Write Better, Get Published, Be Creative | WritersDigest.com and start reading, and reading, and reading, and prepare yourself to up your game in a major way in terms of taking the initiative to do research on your own.

Freelance writing is something that many people from all over the world is taking up, whether it is on part time or a full time basis. You must start with writing and keep writing for a considerable time when you know that you can write regularly when needed. Once you are sure that you can write on various topics whenever asked, you can start by following a ROADMAP and start off as a freelancer. Take it slowly and easily and I am sure you will do great! I hope this helps. Please let me know if you have more questions. All the best!

Wording of the question when I answered: How can I become a freelance writer and where do I do it? Here’s the truth: If you don’t already know how, then you can’t. And if you can’t, location doesn’t matter.

You need to decide on the sphere you want to work in. There are different writing websites on the web. All you need to do is google and see what their requirements are. There is a bunch of information on how to improve your writing skills as well.
